channel.title: Models on data science
channel.description: Recent content in Models on data science

item.title: Regression Models and Classification
item.description: There are two uses for models, inference and prediction. The former focuses on the information gained from the model in the sense of a variable being a significant influence on the response variable in question and by how much. The latter’s focus is on predicting the value of the response variable given one/some explanatory variables. This one doesn’t care much about ease of interpretation but more on accuracy (the opposite for inference).
